items.label: Module 3: The Robot Brain - Perception and Navigation

module-1-nervous-system/intro-to-ros2.title: Introduction to ROS 2 - The Robot's Nervous System
module-1-nervous-system/intro-to-ros2.description: Learn ROS 2 architecture using the biological nervous system analogy - understanding nodes, topics, and services

module-1-nervous-system/nodes-and-topics.title: Nodes and Topics in Practice - Your First ROS 2 Code
module-1-nervous-system/nodes-and-topics.description: Write your first ROS 2 nodes in Python - Talker and Listener using rclpy publish-subscribe pattern

module-1-nervous-system/urdf-modeling.title: URDF Modeling - Bridging Brain and Body
module-1-nervous-system/urdf-modeling.description: Learn URDF (Unified Robot Description Format) to model robot structure with links and joints

module-2-digital-twin/gazebo-fortress-se.title: Physics with Gazebo Fortress
module-2-digital-twin/gazebo-fortress-se.description: Learn rigid body dynamics, install Gazebo Fortress, and understand URDF vs SDF formats

module-2-digital-twin/intro-digital-twin.title: The Digital Twin
module-2-digital-twin/intro-digital-twin.description: Learn what a digital twin is and why simulation is critical before deploying physical robots

module-2-digital-twin/simulating-sensors.title: Adding Eyes & Ears (Sensors)
module-2-digital-twin/simulating-sensors.description: Learn how to add LiDAR and depth cameras to robots using Gazebo plugins and GPU ray tracing

module-2-digital-twin/unity-visualizatio.title: High-Fidelity Rendering in Unity
module-2-digital-twin/unity-visualizatio.description: Learn when to use Unity instead of Gazebo for photorealistic rendering and human-robot interaction visualization

module-3-robot-brain/intro.title: Module 3: The Robot Brain - Perception and Navigation
